page.title: 01The Calne-Cherhill Area
page.content:
Our area consists of the south east corner of the town of{Calne,}the village of{Cherhill,}the hamlets of {Calstone Wellington}and{Theobald's {Green,}and all, or part of, 23 farms.
So the area is mainly farmland but is quite well populated. A rather unusual aspect of the area is the presence of several{American Forces}families living in R.A.F. married quarters between{Cherhill}and{Compton Bassett.
The main{A4 London to Bristol}road runs directly east-west through the area but this has become less busy and congested than it was since the M4 motorway opened in December 1971.
The{River Marden,}a tributary of the Avon, rises and flows through the area past an old watermill at{Quemerford. }
